body.p: Nonetheless, the Board decided to clarify the meaning of ‘testing’ in paragraph 17, noting that such a clarification might help an entity in determining when an asset is available for use. The Board concluded that when testing whether an asset is functioning properly, an entity assesses the technical and physical performance of the asset. The assessment of functioning properly is not an assessment of the financial performance of an asset, such as assessing whether the asset has achieved the level of operating margin initially anticipated by management.
